intro: Erigeron patens, commonly known as the plains fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and sandy soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron patens is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
